thread.title: DeMarco Murray gripes about lack of touches after Eagles' loss
thread.title_full: DeMarco Murray gripes about lack of touches after Eagles' loss - CBSSports.com

author: Sean Wagner-McGough
title: DeMarco Murray gripes about lack of touches after Eagles' loss
text:
Is DeMarco Murray underutilized by Chip Kelly?
After the Eagles ' latest loss, this time to the Redskins, reporters wondered if Murray could be relied on more heavily by the Eagles. When they asked Murray about his usage, this is what he had to say:
Is DeMarco Murray getting enough touches? Murray: "No, I'm not. I don't think I am."...Said he knew what he signed up for, but expected more
— Zach Berman (@ZBerm) October 4, 2015 Murray: "I love this offense, I love playing with these guys. It's how it is.”
— Zach Berman (@ZBerm) October 4, 2015 Murray:"I knew I was going to be the lead guy. I knew Sproles and Mathews, 2 great guys. I knew this offense, a lot of guys touch the ball."
— Zach Berman (@ZBerm) October 4, 2015 Murray on whether he'd go to coaches about it:“I don't need to go to anyone. It is what it is. I think we'll all watch film and get better."
— Zach Berman (@ZBerm) October 4, 2015 On Sunday, Murray ran the ball eight times for 36 yards (30 of those yards came on one run) and caught two passes for 12 yards. On the season, Murray is averaging 13.3 touches per game. Last year, behind the Cowboys offensive line, Murray averaged 28.1 touches per game and led the league in rushing.
The Eagles, picked by many -- including me -- to represent the NFC in the Super Bowl, are 1-3, leading quarterback Sam Bradford to say this after the game:
Sam Bradford on preseason expectations: "I think, at this point, when you're 1-3, those expectations are gone."
— Zach Berman (@ZBerm) October 4, 2015 Yeah, it's been that kind of year in Philadelphia. DeMarco Murray complained that he wasn't getting the ball enough. (USATSI) Topics: DeMarco Murray , Philadelphia Eagles , NFL
